factoids: Genesis block created with 50 BTC
First Transaction between Satoshi Nakamoto (the creator of bitcoin) and Hal Finney (the developer of the bitcoin technology)
Exchange rate between bitcoin and USD is established at 1USD = 1,309.03 BTC
Bitcoin Market, the first official cryptocurrency stock exchange is launched
[Laszlo Hanyecz] (indirectly) buys Papa John's pizza for 10,000 BTC
Bitcoin is mentioned on slashdot.org and drives an increase in users
Bitcoin exchange rate increases 10 times in ten days
MtGox Cryptocurrency exchange is launched in China
Bitcoin reaches parity with the US Dollar
Stocks open to exchange BTC for GBP and BRL
Time magazine publishes an article about cryptocurrency
BitPay, a bitcoin payment service provider is launched

Bitcoin makes its way to mainstream television. It's mentioned in an episode of 'The Good Wife' where Jim Cramer testifies that bitcoin is not a true currency saying that there's no central bank to regulate it and it's digital and completely peer to peer.
Wordpress begins to accept payments
Reward in mining bitcoin halves for the first time from 50 BTC to 25 BTC
Bitcoin based payment processor Coinbase reported selling $1 million USD worth of bitcoins a single month.
FBI seized roughly 26,000 BTC from silk road during the arrest of alleged owner Ross William
China banned the use of cryptocurrency
One of the largest bitcoin exchanges, Mt. Gox suspends withdrawls and files for bankruptcy. They claim 744,000 bitcoins were stolen
The Chicago Sun-Times accepts payment in bitcoin for subscriptions
Newegg and Dell start accepting bitcoin
Microsoft begins accepting bitcoin to buy Xbox games and Windows software
Payment Provider Stripe launches integration to process bitcoin
Coinbase, a cryptocurrency exchange raises 75 million USD in funding
Bitstamp a UK-based exchange had 19,000 BTC stolen

New York State Department of Financial Services released rules to regular Bitcoin and digital currency business that serve customers located in the New York State. These are the first government rules aimed at digital currency enterprises
Japan acknowledges virtual currencies like Bitcoin as payment means on equal basis with real money.
Bidorbuy opens, the largest south African online cryptocurrency market
Steam begins accepting bitcoin
Second Halving Day where reward of mining blocks dropped from 25 Bitcoin to 12.5
Bitfinex, a large exchange is attacked taking almost 120,000 bitcoins
Bitcoins breaks the $1,000 mark
Japan recognizes bitcoin as a legal method of payment
Bitcoin reaches the $3,000 mark
Bitcoin is split into two derivative digital currencies, classic Bitcoin (BTC) and Bitcoin Cash (BCH)
Bitcoin reaches the $5,000 mark
Bitcoin price exceeds $10,000 mark
Bitcoin nearly reaches the $20,000 mark
Steam stops accepting bitcoin citing slow transaction speeds and price volatility
South Korea announces additional measures to regulate bitcoin
South Korea launches an investigation of cryptocurrency services offered by local banks
Stripe announced it would phase out support for processing bitcoin transactions citing slow transaction speeds and rising fees
Facebook bans people from advertising bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies
Bitcoin drops below $10,000
Google and Twitter ban advertising bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies
SEC states that cryptocurrency trading platforms should be registered with the SEC as exchanges
Goldman Sachs announces to open a Bitcoin trading operation
Justice Department opened a case investigating illegal activities affecting the price of bitcoin
Bitcoin Cash splits into two currencies. Bitcoin Cash and Bitcoin SV. This causes a decline in prices
Bitcoin mining drops significantly
Coinstar Machines start selling Bitcoin at grocery stores across the US
Canadian Crypto Exchange QuadrigaCX Goes Bankrupt after the founder Gerald Cotten who knew the passwords to 'cold storage' unexpectedly died in India in December
Bitwise study finds that the majority of bitcoin trading volume is faked by unregulated exchanges
Facebook launches 'Libra', it's own cryptocurrency
Unicef begins accepting crypto donations
CME Group Launched Bitcoin options
COVID-19 is declared a pandemic by the WHO
Paul Tudor Jones Buys Bitcoin as a Hedge Against Inflation
Bitcoin halves block mining reward a third time from 12.5 BTC to 6.25 BTC
China orders their bitcoin miners to shutdown in an 'Orderly Manner'
Twitter accounts for Elon Musk, Bill Gayes, Kanye West, Barrack Obama and many more are hacked and they ask their followers to send funds to a specific wallet
MicroStrategy purchases $250 million USD worth of Bitcoins (21,453 BTC)
Square Buys $50 million USD in Bitcoin
Paypal launches Bitcoin and Crypto
US Government Seized $1 Billion in Bitcoin from Silk Road
Microstrategy raises more money so it can buy more crypto
Bitcoin Passes $20k mark for the first time
Coinbase files for IPO
Bitcoin surpasses $30,000 mark
Elon Musk changes his twitter bio to '#bitcoin'
Tesla reveals they bought 1.5 Billion USD worth of bitcoin
Bitcoin exceeds $50,000 mark
Tesla announces that you can purchase cars in Bitcoin
Bitcoin exceeds $60,0000 mark
Turkey Bans cryptocurrency payments
Venmo allows buying and selling cryptocurrencies
Tesla stops accepting payments in bitcoin citing environmental concerns
China crackdowns on usage of cyrptocurrencies
Bitcoin begins to plunge
El Salvador becomes the first country in the world to allow Bitcoin as legal tender
